name: Fractal Dimension Analysis
description: Measures the fractal complexity of image texture. Natural images typically have fractal dimensions in the range 2.3-2.7, while AI-generated images often deviate from this range.
mechanism: Applies box-counting method at multiple scales to estimate fractal dimension of image intensity surface. The fractal dimension quantifies self-similarity across scales.
parameters: Box sizes: 4 to 64 pixels, Scales: 8 levels, Method: differential box-counting
source: Sarkar & Chaudhuri (1994) — An Efficient Differential Box-Counting Approach, IEEE SMC
useCase: Detecting deviations from natural fractal complexity in AI images

references.title: Sarkar, N. & Chaudhuri, B.B. (1994). An Efficient Differential Box-Counting Approach to Compute Fractal Dimension. IEEE SMC.

strengths:
• Based on mathematical fractal theory
• Captures multi-scale complexity
• Resolution-adaptive analysis
• Independent of content type
limitations:
• Narrow natural range makes discrimination difficult
• Sensitive to image quality
• Computational cost at many scales
• AI models can mimic fractal properties
